#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Makedonski Brod
#Text=Makedonski Brod is a town in Western North Macedonia , on the south-eastern part of Suva Gora , western Karadžica , and south-western Dautica mountains .
#Text=The Makedonski Brod Municipality , which consists of the town and 50 surrounding villages , contains the historical region of Poreče which is tied to the Treska River .
#Text=This region has countless old villages with traditional Macedonian architecture .
#Text=Aside from this , it is known for its several important caves .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Makedonski Brod and the larger Poreče region is situated in the west of Macedonia , south of Skopje .
#Text=It can be reached from highway A-2 by taking R1303 east , from Prilep by taking that same road west , and from Skopje by taking R1106 .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Poreče is a relatively large region with villages scattered around it .
#Text=Therefore , a car or bicycle will be needed to get from place to place .
#Text=Caves
#Text=Pešna ( Пешна ) , village of Devič .
#Text=Just six kilometers ( 3.6 miles ) from Makedonski Brod is the cave Pešna which features the largest cave opening in the Balkans .
#Text=It is 124 m ( 407 ft ) deep .
#Text=The New York Times has compared the cave to something out of The Lord of the Rings .
#Text=There are streams nearby including the mini-waterfall of Pešnica , as well as archaeological remains including Devini Towers ( listed below ) .
#Text=A church has been constructed near the cave .
#Text=Zmejovica ( Змејовица ) , village of Krapa .
#Text=Above the village of Krapa on Dautica Mountain is this hard-to-find cave .
#Text=It can be reached by a 40-minute hike from the village , though the path is n't marked well and the opening to the cave is a hole in the ground amongst a grassy field .
#Text=Nonetheless , the cave is 68 m ( 223 ft ) in length and has a main hall 15 m ( 49 ft ) tall and a smaller one 3 m ( 10 ft ) tall .
#Text=There are multiple local legends connected to Zmejovica .
#Text=Slatinski Izvor ( Слатински Извор ) , village of Slatina .
#Text=Macedonia 's biggest cave , extending over 4 km ( 2.4 mi ) in length .
#Text=Of this estimated length , only about 800 m has been explored .
#Text=The cave has a subterranean river .
#Text=It was added to the country 's tentative list of World Heritage Sites in 2004 .
#Text=Puralo ( Пурало ) , village of Slatina .
#Text=This cave has a narrow opening surrounded by trees and other greenery that often mask the opening .
#Text=Puralo is a river cave with a complex branching of canals .
#Text=Golubarnica ( Голубарница ) , village of Belica .
#Text=This cave contains the source of the Belica River , the Treska 's largest tributary , just east of the village .
#Text=It is 100 meters long and is home to a population of bats .
#Text=There is also evidence of human history in the cave , exemplified by a human skull that remains in the cave .
#Text=Laparnica ( Лапарница ) , village of Belica .
#Text=This cave extends over 88 meters long and is home to a year-round population of bats .
#Text=The cave features stalactites , stalagmites , and small pools of water .
#Text=Churches and monasteries
#Text=The Makedonski Brod area is home to one significant monastery and several historic churches .
#Text=Poreče Monastery ( Поречки манастир ) , village of Gorni Manastirec .
#Text=Established in the 12 century , this monastery was destroyed at some point following the start of Ottoman rule .
#Text=A local effort led to the re-establishment of the monastery in 1846 and it soon became a cultural and educational hub for this region .
#Text=It contains one church dedicated to the Nativity of the Virgin Mary , built in 1899 .
#Text=Built of stone , the church 's frescoes were done with egg yolk .
#Text=The monastery has a high location on a mountainside , overlooking the surroundings .
#Text=Church of St Demetrius ( Црква „ Св . Димитриј “ ) , village of Trebino .
#Text=The main church of Trebino , St Demetrius was built in 1664 .
#Text=Its frescoes were also completed around this time and are of high quality .
#Text=The courtyard contains the village cemetery .
#Text=Church of St Athanasius the Great ( Црква „ Св .
#Text=Атанасиј Велики “ ) , village of Modrište .
#Text=Among the older churches of the region , this one was built of stone in 1728 and is a monastery church .
#Text=Its frescoes date from the time of its construction .
#Text=A church has existed at this site since the 13th century .
#Text=Church of the Holy Mother of God ( Црква „ Св . Богородица “ ) , town of Makedonski Brod .
#Text=The main church of the municipal centre of Makedonski Brod .
#Text=Built in 1872 , its iconostasis was done in 1885 by an artist from Kruševo .
#Text=Church of St Panteleimon ( Црква „ Св . Пантелејмон “ ) , village of Belica .
#Text=The main church of Belica was built in 1873 of stone .
#Text=It has a belfry attached at the front entrance and a cross atop the roof , as well as the village cemetery in its courtyard .
#Text=The nearby Church of St Nicholas is small but older , built in the 16th century .
#Text=Church of the Presentation of the Virgin Mary ( Црква „ Воведение на Пресвета Богородица “ ) , village of Zdunje .
#Text=This small church was built in the 17th century , though its frescoes were n't completed until 1922 .
#Text=It sits on a hill above Lake Kozjak and its courtyard contains the village cemetery .
#Text=Church of St Nicholas ( Црква „ Св . Никола “ ) , village of Sušica .
#Text=Built in 1890 in this mountainside village , the Church of St Nicholas is a charming stone-built church with a prominent detached bell tower .
#Text=Church of Sts Constantine and Elena ( Црква „ Св . Константин и Елена “ ) , village of Tomino Selo .
#Text=This 19th century church built of stone has a courtyard that looks out onto valleys below .
#Text=Church of St Athanasius ( Црква „ Св . Атанасиј “ ) , village of Topolnica .
#Text=The Church of St Athanasius was built in 1872 and is mostly ordinary in design aside from its unique bell tower situated on its front facade .
#Text=Built of dark stone , the tower is capped by a dome and a cross .
#Text=Other sights
#Text=Devini Towers ( Девини Кули ) , village of Devič .

#Text=Within the in the vicinity of the cave Pešna on a hill above the Treska River are remnants of a medieval fortress which were , according to legend , built for Deva and Pešna , two of the four sisters of King Marko .
#Text=Kosturnica Monument ( Спомен-костурница ) , village of Gorni Manastirec .
#Text=On the road toward the Poreče Monastery is this monument to the 103 victims killed by Bulgarian forces on Christmas eve , 1916 .
#Text=The monument is a small building topped by a dome with a cross .
